summary.para: Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified XrmTimeSpan object.

param.name: value
param.para: Type: . Specifies the XrmTimeSpan instance to test for equality with the current instance.

returns.para: Type: Booleantrue if the value represents the same time interval as the current XrmTimeSpan structure; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified object.

param.name: obj
param.para: Type: Object. Specifies the object to test for equality with the current instance.

returns.para: Type: Booleantrue if value is a XrmTimeSpan object that represents the same time interval as the current XrmTimeSpan structure; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Indicates whether two XrmTimeSpan instances are equal.

param.name: span1
param.para: Type: . Specifies a XrmTimeSpan.

param.name: span2
param.para: Type: . Specifies a XrmTimeSpan.

returns.para: Type: Booleantrue if the values of span1 and span2 are equal; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Indicates whether two XrmTimeSpan instances are not equal.

param.name: span1
param.para: Type: . Specifies a XrmTimeSpan.

param.name: span2
param.para: Type: . Specifies a XrmTimeSpan.

returns.para: Type: Booleantrue if the values of span1 and span2 are not equal; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Returns a Boolean type. true of the values of span1 and span2 are not equal; otherwise false.

remarks.para: This is an entity instance of the type specified by the EntityName property. On input, the attribute values that have been set will be used to create the record. Only attribute values for attributes that are valid for create and that the user has access to create will be used, all others will be ignored.
On output, this the entity instance that was created.

A workflow dependency for this entity will be added.

summary.para: Gets the number of whole days represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

returns.para: Type: Int32 The number of whole days represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

remarks.para: The value of this property is an Int32 type that is the day component of this instance. The return value can be positive or negative.

summary.para: Gets the number of whole hours represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

returns.para: Type: Int32The number of whole hours represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

remarks.para: The value of this property is an Int32 type that is the hours component of this instance. The return value ranges from -23 through 23.

summary.para: Gets the number of whole minutes represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

returns.para: Type: Int32 The number of whole minutes represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

remarks.para: The value of this property is an Int32 type that is the minutes component of this instance. The return value ranges from -59 through 59.

summary.para: Gets the number of whole months represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

returns.para: Type: Int32 The number of whole months represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

remarks.para: The value of this property is an Int32 type that is the months component of this instance. The return value ranges from -12 through 12.

summary.para: Gets the number of whole years represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

returns.para: Type: Int32 The number of whole years represented by the current XrmTimeSpan structure.

remarks.para: The value of this property is an Int32 type that is the years component of this instance.

summary.para: For internal use only.

members.member:
Activity used to assign a record to a new owner or routes it to a queue.

Creates an record.

Retrieves the value of an entity attribute and converts the value to the specified type.

Retrieves an entity reference for the primary entity for the workflow instance.
Custom XAML Workflows

Suspends the workflow until the specified date and time.
Use this activity type instead of the Windows Workflow FoundationDelay activity. Custom XAML Workflows

summary.para: Specifies a description for the argument.

summary.para: Indicates the argument is a property of a message request.
Indicates the argument is a property of a message response.

members.member:
Specifies the direction, either input or output, for an action argument.
An input argument becomes a custom property on the message request of an action. An output argument becomes a custom property on the message response of an action. Create your own actions

summary.para: Identifies the argument is an entity to be passed to the workflow at run-time.

members.member:
Specifies that the argument is required.
Create your own actions

Identifies the argument is the primary entity for which the workflow is run.
This attribute is automatically generated or added and is optional for global actions. Create your own actions
